Growing up, I don't recall instances when my parents verbally taught a specific gospel principles.

Instead, we learned gospel lessons and lessons for life in a personal, customized way,

Throughout these lessons.

They had a way of presenting both the letter of law as well as the spirit of the law.

Without diminishing my worth as a person.

I was somewhat shielded from facing the world and its demand.

Lesson taught,

Without fanfare or drama

Gradual shifting.

With their departure, I have lost an advocate.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

The AI in a way.

Takes away the excercising of free agency.

One correct answer, out of how many possibilities
